poem:
### Cinema's Whisper

In the flicker of screen,  
our lives unfold—  
a teenage heart,  
heavy with words unsaid.  

Drama, a crucible—  
tragedy distilled.  
In the quiet between frames,  
echoes of our own shy selves  
linger,  
aching for light,  
a span of 60 seconds  
where truth dares  
to emerge from shadow.

However, rather than focusing on conflicted teenager Shy (played with wonderful nuance by Jay Lycurgo), Porter gives us a day". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
